nodes.text: People that believe that the Italian South is inferior are shortshighted and narrow-minded
The Italian South is  unquestionably inferior economically to the North but economic prosperity is not  necessarily a true indicator of the quality of a society s life.
While materially  24  impoverished the South has produced many of Italy s greatest men of letters and affairs.
To cite only a few of her political thinkers of note she can claim Vico Cuoco Mosca  Croce and Dorso.
She also remains the land of the wondrous scenic beauties described  by Goethe in his Italienische Reise
as well as of architectural marvels like the Baroque  churches of Apulia
It would be extremely shortsighted to view the South as simply or  even primarily a place where poverty illiteracy poor soil earthquakes brigandage and  disease abound
Italian South is considered inferior a land of poverty and brigandage
The Italian South is incredibly rich of culture and has an high quality of life
If the stereotype that Italian South is inferior is open-minded and correct the South is lacking in quality of life and culture
The Italian South is economically and culturally different from the North
Different is often taken to mean inferior by insensitive observers both Italian and foreign.
In much of the recent literature in the social sciences southern Italy is viewed as an  underdeveloped country in comparison with its northern counterpart
If a country is economically inferior it is inferior under every point of view
